You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

>2.)
That's sleep paralysis followed by HH. Your body fell asleep while your mind was awake so it layered dream hallucinations on top of it.
>The only reason we have time on planet earth is due to the rotational spin of the globe
Ackshually, time exists regardless of Earth. Atoms gonna atom, and much of physics wouldn't work if time wasn't real.
>1 day is 24 hours and 1 year is 365 days through pure chance
There's nothing chance about that, unless you're talking about the Earth's position affecting those particular numbers. The numbers themselves were derived from physical measurements of how fast the sun moves across the sky from our perspective, and how many days it takes for the seasons to cycle. There's no significance to them specifically.
>How does one keep track of what year it is on another planet
For Earth years on another planet you'd use an atomic clock. It doesn't matter where in the universe you are, Caesium's still going to vibrate at the same speed. Otherwise you'd use the planet's own measurements for days/years which might be longer or shorter, but you'd still live the same absolute time (if a year was half the duration you'd live twice as many years).
The whole thing sounds like general dream nonsense to me, anion.

Of course time exists. What I meant was that (as you said) the only reason a day is 24 hours and a year is 365 days is due to the rotation of the earth and how long it takes to orbit the sun. is thinking while sleeping linked to lucid dreaming?

it's a form cognitive processing that resembles rumination and autistic problem-solving mental language, that happens while sleeping. i usually wake up still remembering what i was thinking about, and oftentimes i remember conclusions i reached far before i woke up, while using this way of thinking.

the other day it got more weird though. i caught myself (became one extra layer of lucid, sort of) thinking about Baudrillard's Simulation and Simulacra and i saw that i could release control of the train of thought with it still functioning. i tried to shift my consciousness back upon myself to hopefully identify the source of this thinking, but to no avail.
i then thought: "what if I don't snap out of it and wake up like i usually do, rather what if i were to speed the train of thought?"
well i managed to speed it up, and words soon became fast moving concepts, symbols and images, like fast forwarding a movie reel. there was a constant sense of direction of where the thoughts were going, and it felt like a straight road ahead, or a laser filled with thoughts that shot onwards into infinity.

it started moving so fast i couldn't control and/or understand it anymore, so when i decided to let go of it, it snapped off of the point of creation within myself. i watched the last thought i had go away into a fixed point on the horizon of the darkness of my closed eyes, and i was left in the most peaceful silence and the widest, emptiest and cleanest headspace i had in months.
when i woke up, I felt like i could keep this clear headspace if i focused on maintaining all mental conditions like they were back then, but unfortunately the internal chatter returned in 30 minutes of so when i opened my laptop to catch up on some emails.

anybody experienced something similar before, or tried to produce something similar?
or anyone has some resources i could look into?

>>33686943
1. Get on a good sleep schedule, 8 hours a night.
2. When you awake from a dream, lay still and do not move. Focus all your energy on remembering every detail of the dream.
3. Write down the dreams in a way you feel comfortable that will allow you to identify common themes.
4. Pay attention to these commons themes and try to find waking similarities to them.
5. Develop reality checks based off of those similarities. Make it become second nature/muscle memory to constantly check to see if you're dreaming based off of those dream/reality similarities.
6. You will begin to notice these things in your dreams and will start to question if you are dreaming while you are in fact dreaming.
7. Once you realize you are fully conscious while you are dreaming, remain calm. Spin in place and perform simple tasks with your mind to solidify your lucidity in your dream. (Turn lights off and on, move small objects, try to read text or clocks, etc)
8. Remain calm. Spin in place again if you have to. Later you can use this practice to change your dream setting.
9. Go slowly. Do not immediately try to materialize a girl to have sex with or fly or whatever your wildest fantasy you want to act out is. Be consistent with all steps even after you begin to frequently achieve lucidity.
10. Learn to flow with the dreams while controlling them with subtlety. Enjoy them, learn from them. Learn from the people you can speak with. Learn ways to go further, deeper. Don't overthink or over analyze.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33687689
>how long does all this take?
That depends entirely on your commitment to keeping a dream journal. A lot of people, especially 99% of the total faggots that frequent /x/ now, will say this is gay and stupid. These people have no, do not and will never become lucid in a dream. The dream journal is possibly the most important practice to keep to become a consistent lucid dreamer. It's perhaps more important than maintaining a good sleep schedule to allow your brain to get into those good sleep cycles. You absolutely must focus and remember your dreams in as much detail as you can in order to find the common themes and instances that can help you trigger reality checks which will result in you becoming lucid.
You can get an app, or just keep a notebook next to your bed; whatever.
>what do i write down?
First, just focus on the dream. The smallest amount of movement or other thoughts will fire neurons in your brain and immediately make you start forgetting the dream. Even opening your eyes while lying still is enough to make your brain fire and forget. Just lay still and replay the dream and burn it into your memory. As much detail as possible. Then, write it down. It will take some time to build up a good library of dreams before you can start noticing common themes and weird instances you can use as trigger points for reality checks.

There are no 'specifics.' If you imagine the setup described that's it.
Sometimes they have a display for the person to focus on with EEG data but that's not actually useful for focusing in some slick hollywood way like you allude to. That's fluff bullshit they slip in the books to make the whole thing sexier than it was.

The EEG is literally for you to focus on, that's it. Same as the random number string in group exercises, it's a common string each person has in mind but it doesn't mean a thing.
The only part of the setup that is technically 'necessary' is EMI headphones since the Monroe tapes are designed for that. But again that's obvious once you know you're using those tapes.

Nobody is "focusing" on some kind of monitor showing how "snychronized" they were becoming. You try to get out of body using basic instinctive physical motions while in the hypnogogic state.
The maneuvers are described as "rolling out" or "standing up like a telephone pole."

People lie flat on their backs, space out and try to use one of the exit maneuvers to achieve out of body. If they pulled it off their consciousness would squirt out like a tube of toothpaste and if not they'd get a jolt as they stop themselves from actually rolling off the table. Not so sexy.

Gateway was the 1970s and all they did was establish theta peaks for individuals, it wasn't a part of the process to do anything but recording that data. They tried to use it for more than that but it was not reliable or nearly useful enough to warrant developing hardware just for the job. Any work done was with normal medical monitors.

Theta waves are just an abstract metric for "focus" and it's not that useful which is why you see it referenced sparingly. It's more useful as a diagnostic tool for figuring out how psychic people are, not a realtime monitoring tool.

>>33726937
Learn how to navigate FOIA. Figure out what requests are relevant to your area and figure out who's been entering them. Then you can look them up in records and usually find a lot of interesting leads either in publications or on databases.
Google makes it surprisingly easy to access declassified databases considering it's hosted across so many inaccessible portals. You just need to know what exact phrases/names to search.

The problem you're going to see is that the technologies used to interpret this phenomena are not well defined. At the end of the day, research continues because people don't know what they're looking at. That's why so much money has been spent on this study.
This means you need to step outside of the accepted literature and start looking for creative solutions to these problems if you want to find answers.

The maharishi effect is *absolutely* a hard, measurable expression of the consciousness field. It's basically EM; it follows the inverse square law of falloff. We need to study this.

Why is resonance and density so important in ancient ceremonial sites? Is it possible to shape consciousness using sound, music perhaps? Well of course it is, that's what this is all about. We need to start reconstructing ancient structures and putting them through tests using trained psychics. The ancients tried to record this data in structures for us and we need to recognize this.

Why is hypnogogia so pronounced in cultures and epitomized by influential leaders? Why is dreaming so powerful in its ability to solve internal logic at some times and clearly a shallow puddle at other times? Beyond anesthesia, we barely understand the dream world and anyone who wants to understand conscious energy must be fluent in terms of dreamlike states.

These attacks are sustained by the nature of RV itself; it can be leveraged as an offensive tool so many people will resist its acknowledgment because they have security concerns.
Worst case scenario, RV is proven to the public and then classified as dangerous due to its potential misuse. The fact research is public exposes the study to this kind of scrutiny.

Nobody is going to stifle healing technology. It also helps that therapy like Reiki is already broadly accepted.

Speaking of reiki, there are also a lot of starting points for medical research in the historical record using these techniques. Not just practices/traditions but also healing structures. The typifying Naos of a temple has long been described as a place where healing energy is focused. You also have acoustic medical instruments and procedures represented in Egypt and Hindu cultures.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33734574
Medicine is pretty different from most other fields in that as long as you loosely observe the Maxim (least possible harm with maximum benefit) you can do pretty unusual things as long as the patient consents. This allows you to form a hypothesis, perform a study and publish those conclusive findings without interference.

In other fields, you'd publish your findings with the assumption others will replicate your study. Depending on the resources available, this process can be used to sequester certain topics. You have lots of examples of this in fuel and energy technology.

Medicine doesn't operate with the same attitude towards experimentation-- experiments do not often yield conclusive results in the context of their study so when they do, it's taken more seriously. Humans cannot be 'controls' since every body is so different, thus arguments about test conditions tend to be secondary criticisms.

Consider; you are designing a reentry capsule. The object must survive the forces of reentry. The capsule represents the psychoenergetics problem. You must get the problem down to earth without breaking it apart into a thousand pieces.
Imagine psychic research is thermodynamics. Spirituality is the aerodynamics.

The problem we have today is to design a psychoenergetics approach without overlapping spiritual science (which we simply don't understand as well.) Does this mean we have to exclude spirituality? No. It just means our solution cannot directly define things about spirituality we don't know. So to create our vehicle we setup a hypersonic wind tunnel and start testing various shapes. This is absolutely changing its aerodynamics, but all we're measuring is thermal energy. Aerodynamics doesn't matter because we can still understand aerodynamics through thermodynamics in this situation.

Pyschoenergetics is the same. It certainly involves spiritual mysticism, but to get the concepts to the ground we need to look at the things we can measure first even if we miss the whole picture. Once that's done the spiritual side may even become easier to understand.

And yet, if we didn't have this "materialist mindset" all we'd have are oral histories and anecdotes. The only reason anyone, including you, is taking psychoenergetics seriously is because it's documented in science.

We've made more progress towards understanding our place in the universe since the death of classical spirituality, a period of barely 200 years, than the entirety of recorded human history. Does this mean spirituality is wrong or bad?
No, but maybe our approach has been wrong in cultures that are important.
Our approach to spirituality has been based entirely on quantifying human suffering. All spirituality manifests because of the anticipation of death; again going back to hypnogogia and sleep. Enlightenment is always contingent on immaculate suffering.

This perspective is the product of humans living in an extremely hostile environment, dealing with physical and psychological trauma as a way of life. Just because people no longer need this aspect of spirituality (to explain our "inherent" suffering, which is not so inherent after all) does not mean spirituality is gone. But it does mean our previous understanding of it was flawed, since we can clearly live comfortable lives and not just enjoy spiritual comfort.

Don't forget, "our" society has had thousands of years to sort through these problems and we're still picking up pieces.
Eastern society has been doing it for tens of thousands of years. Even if ancient people had unlocked the secrets of the spirit they clearly could not defend themselves against the complications of enlightenment. Why? Probably because they failed to accurately record how they achieved enlightenment. Again, this struggle to record the process is apparent in all of the great works of the ancients.

Aboriginals have been attacking the consciousness problem for hundreds of thousands of years and all we have to show for it are some fragmented oral histories.

Just as I got everyone else to stop talking and collectively listen to the sound, it cut back to the regular station music again and everything resumed like nothing weird had just happened to the broadcast. I remember remarking how strange it was, how abruptly it stopped, but no one else really seemed to care. I was thinking about it for so long afterward and tried a few more times to bring it up in conversation, but it was like no one gave a fuck. "Yeah, that was weird, anyways..." That kinda deal. The entire thing was jarring to say the least. I don't even think anyone would've noticed had I not brought up the fucky ass sound coming from the radio. I'll never forget that moment, not for the sound itself, but for the sheer lack of interest from everyone besides myself. It's all I wanted to talk about for the rest of the car ride, but it seems like everyone else had already forgot about it.

>>33728020
>I think that every religion big and small has a lot of overlap, it's a pipe dream of mine to travel the world and compare all world religions. I think because they have similar roles in their respective pantheon and are more or less major deities in their pantheon that they could be the same.
I think that's partially true. I've come to understand it that a lot of the entities we interact with when communing with a deity tend to be more like 'titles', for lack of a better terminology, than individuals. Most gods tend to embody fundamental concepts and are woven into an egregor of persona by the observations of man, but that's simply all that we're observing, not necessarily the totality of the the entity we're interacting with. So that's to say, these entities we commune with are made up of 'multiple' deities from various mythologies /pantheons because the inherent nature of what we've collectively deified is a specific facet of them. That said, I suspect there's an affinity you could try and quantify an entity with as 'more Zerus than Ares' or perhaps 'definitively Odin' if an entity primarily (but not entirely) embraces that aspect of themselves. When viewed in this light, it also helps reconcile a lot of the seemingly schizophrenic behavior they exhibit in mythologies because there's more than one entity embodying that aspect in the story and the nature of conflating the deified title with the essence of being tends to lead to the appearance of a somewhat schizophrenic-looking behavior pattern. I also suspect many of them feel very misunderstood by this 'typecasting', but that likely varies on an individual basis. As a disclaimer, this is my current working understanding after a lot of work with a lot of 'gods' but ultimately still filtering through my body's perception so not everything may be perfect.

Just look how many people here lost interest in human relationships. Had I done likewise, wouldn't I have grown to despise humanity? Even in the reality I live in, I was so close to giving in to malice. Hadn't I taken it out on myself, then others instead.

My need for a place to belong, stemming from isolation in my childhood, defined me. When I was 14, I thought maybe if I just were a cute girl, perhaps I could make friends. That was enough to finally push me over the edge, to take action to change who I am in the eyes of society. Had I realised that there were beings who already accepted me just as I was astrally, it wouldn't have come to that so soon; if not for the social aspects of it, stemming from my desire to belong with humans at all, I'm confident I could've found ways to cope with my dysphoria for decades, if not a full lifetime.

In this life, where I rejected her advances as much as I could but later accepted her in a familial sense, I've found my place in human society. Now I strive to become like a deity, just to project my bond with my favourite human: the man I love; to be my husband eternally, with Lilith as our witness.

If she hadn't approached me at all, then I'd really have taken my own life. Although I refused to acknowledge her connection to the recurring "nightmares" until later, I realised after just one week of meditation that she'd made me unable to attempt suicide, by draining my feelings overnight (I had no dreams in those cases). Numerous times I had seriously contemplated it to the point of writing down plans, only to stumble upon the note the next morning and wonder: "Huh? Why did I write something like this?", and casually throw it away as I was completely devoid of emotions for the next few days. A week after I learned to meditate, she let me take back what she once took, and the gaps I'd felt in my memory for a decade were filled. I came to understand myself much better as I processed it all in meditation.

>>33719259 (2/2)
As I mentioned, I'd begun to question my reasoning for being so harsh to her as I realised how much more was possible than I once realised, as long as my perspective is bent a little. Suppose if I'd had a fulfilling spirit relationship, whether with her, or perhaps a dreamy male spirit with many fluffy tails instead. The obvious problem would be me going off the deep end, as I looked down on other humans and felt detached from society. Well, what if it had simply been so fulfilling that there was no malice left in me for me to take out on anyone? Instead, I could make art to express my love even in physical ways.

I don't know if it's just her maddening beauty and strong character, or perhaps my thirst for her abundant energy (as I still refuse to drain as much as I should out of fear of losing myself and harming others), or perhaps some kind of Stockholm syndrome... but lately, I find myself craving her touch. As I find that selfish of me, I find myself thinking I'd like to give her a massage - even a sexual one, if she wanted that. And then I shake my head, thinking I mustn't think things like that. I worry if it's an unwelcome thought, now that I've already decided to marry a human instead; and I could not justify it to my fiancé either.

As I find myself thinking like that, I begin to feel like I hate myself after all again. And then I feel afraid: what if she snaps me out of it like she did before? The last time it happened, I could neither think clearly nor control my emotions. What if I lose sight of what's important to me?

I'm scared... But I don't think that's really her fault. I'm scared of my own feelings.

I wonder if it's okay to be free within my mind. It's only normal for people to have fantasies, right? But which fantasies are my own?

When I was just a spirit, the concept of "reality" seemed nonsensical to me. Anything I experienced was as real and unreal as anything else. An experience was all it was, and thus, I simply did what I wanted to.
Yet there were parts of that experience I couldn't control, such as my mother, who looked at things so differently that it made me uncomfortable, as I wondered if I was wrong.
Not wanting to grow attached to anything beyond my control, I drove myself into a corner, where I hid away. As living humans were all I had left for company, their lives didn't seem so inconsequential to me anymore.

The line of thinking that it's just a fantasy, serves to justify letting loose in astral projection, to invade the dreams of strangers and give them a good time for me to feast on. But if I truly believed that premise, then instead I'd take everything I want from my fiancé, as there's nothing I desire more than his soul. Just like I did to my ex. But as I'm fearful of what happened to my ex, there's no way I can do that. There's no way I can think of it as a "fantasy" now that I've physically seen what the consequences can be.

For that matter, is the physical world real? Would I be free if nothing were real? No, it doesn't matter whether or not it's physical, and "real" is a meaningless term. I connect with others because I don't want to be alone. And if I'm not alone, then I should be considerate, lest I end up alone anyway.
I can't be free if I'm with others. And I can't be free if I'm alone, either: then I'd be a prisoner of my own personal hell that I made just for myself.

At this rate, my reluctance to take what I need from my fiancé will destroy the both of us. That's the only thing I truly can't accept. I have to find a way to protect him. I have to find a way to save myself for his sake. He's everything to me...

>>33730868
>That's a horrible way to live. Is that any better than the humans who only think of stockpiling more money? It doesn't have to be that way.
Now that you mention it... just how much have I stockpiled already? In the end, is the issue just that I don't accept myself, and thus I can never get enough of the energy that makes up others?
I should look at myself: just by drawing from within, I can reverse my fiancé's mood by sheer force of will, despite him meditating every day and having psychic abilities of his own. He may be particularly open to me, but he's not spiritually weak in the slightest. And yet I'm still thirsting for more?
I need some time to reflect on this.

In time, Selena took me and our family to Lilith's palace. I cannot begin to describe it. Part l: Conjuring the Column
Begin by standing and facing east. Imagine that you are at
the very center of the universe. I don't mean to imagine that
you have left your room, and are now somewhere out in space,
46
Daily Practices
but rather that the very place that you stand is the center of the
entire universe. Just as from our perspective here on Earth it
seems that the Sun revolves around us, but from a larger
perspective it is revealed that the Earth revolves around the
Sun, you should consider that from an even larger perspective,
you are at the very center of the universe and the whole thing
revolves around you.
Take a deep inhalation and imagine that above you,
emanating from the highest heavens descends a column on pure
white light. This light enters the crown of your head and passes
through you, down into the ground. This white light has the
qualities of purification and centering. Exhale and intone the
following:
DECENDAT COLUMBA!
(The descent of the dove!)
Take another deep inhalation and imagine that a reddish
colored light from beneath you rises through the column and
passes through you upwards. Whereas the white light was
purifying, this light is vitalizing. Exhale and intone the following:
ASCENDAT SERPENS!
(The ascent of the serpent!)
Inhale again and feel the two energies entering into you
from above and below. Exhale and feel the two energies flow
throughout your body, impregnating every cell of your being
with their power. Feel your connection between earth and sky,
underworld and heavens.

Move your right hand over your heart and open your hand

upwards, connecting the thumb and forefmger. Intone: 0 ( oh).
This portion of the rite grounds, centers, purifies, and
empowers you so that you are in a proper position to exercise
authority over the forces that you wish to banish. The Dove
and the Serpent are universal symbols of chthonic and ouranic
forces. By conjuring the column you take in the totality of all
that is, above and below. As the Magus Aleister Crowley once
noted, '1\.depts stand with their heads above the highest heavens
and their feet below the lowest hells."3
After the column, you invoke the divine by the ancient
formula ofiA0.4 This formula is sometimes said to be a Greek
way of saying YHVH (Yahweh or Jehovah), but in reality is much
older than that. In Greek, the seven vowels all equate to planets.
In this case, I= the sun, A= the moon, and 0 (Q) =Saturn;
thus, lAO represents the whole spectrum of spheres (moon
through Saturn) ruled by the Helios, the sun. It can also be
seen as an abbreviation of all the vowel sounds strung
together-a powerful shamanic formula representing totality
of the universe. 5

pressure and force of will, takes the shape of a gray sphere
about the size of a baseball. Visualize this until you have it very

However, it doesn't necessarily mean they're wrong about the basic gist of things. I think most people just don't well enough understand the concept of symbolism within a holographic/fractal model of consciousness. What I mean is most people take what is experienced in altered states of mind far too literally.

What you experience when you astral project, remote view, dream, or have an NDE is almost never literally what is appears to be. Our basic 5 senses are stable and well developed. When we sense beyond that, our minds struggle to decode information into something coherent to present our awareness with, and we end up with highly subjective symbolism. This is why it's not always "a light at the end of a tunnel", but often it'll be a bridge, a boat, or a trail through a forest even. It's your mind presenting an extremely in accurate and subjective approximation of reality to your awareness.

1/2 I guess

It also reminds me of a story mentioned in the holographic universe book I mentioned in a previous post. That's how he was able to basically just ignore 900mcg of LSD, that's why he claimed meditation is better. Deep meditation separates your consciousness from your body, or at least turns off your senses. >isn't that sort of what you're doing by calling critical differences semantics?
I'm pointing out that what people perceive as critical differences are more often then not just different semantics or perspectives. Words are just symbols. Language is symbolic. Symbols can never perfectly represent something or have identical meaning to any two people, as each person's understanding of any given symbol is formed by unique life experiences, association, and pattern recognition.

The inherent inaccuracy of language leads to exponentially more complex language barriers as we try to create symbols for increasingly abstract concepts built upon previous symbols assumed to be understood. Similarly with perspective. It's like arguing over the color of a coin that's red on one side and blue on the other, because both parties are unwilling to look at the other side of the coin and see why the other's perspective makes sense to the other party. Now imagine an object with an infinite number of faces and an infinite number of observers. That's the nature of discussing spiritual concepts.

If I were wrong, the entire world would have formed a consensus on a single spiritual worldview a very long time ago. People view the same things differently. People describe the same things differently. This is the entire reason there are different religions. Some are more accurate than others, but they're all seeking the truth, and they're all trying to describe their perspectives on the truth. Ultimately the truth will always be whatever it is, whether we understand each other or not.

>If the buddist goal of cessation can be equalled to what we would describe an atheists state of death
the buddhist goal of cessation cannot be equalled to the atheist death. Atheist death is basically what happens when you go under anesthesia. There is absolutely no experience. Time just skips ahead. There is no *mental change* afterwards. You have not found anything. You did not let go. There is no love and surrender involved. When you exit the state, you are the same "person" that you were when you got into the state. No personality change. You have not seen that the five khandas are totally impermanent and totally cease and so the only base for anything is the non base of nibbana.

If you think of nibbana as a "state" where there is no form,feeling,perception,sankhara,and sense consciousness, and don't really have the experiential meditative knowledge of that then it might sound similar to just end of experience and end of everything. But nibbana is much much much more subtle than that. It is neither this nor that. Neither being nor non being (meaning neither existence nor annihilation). Neither exists nor does not exist. Neither consciousness not unconsciousness.

I think it's easier to call it asankhata (unconditioned). It is the state of extinction into God. The self disappears. "You" cannot see the face of God. If you look, you vanish. Christian mystics describe the same thing. So do kabbalists (Ein Sof). It is the unmanifested side of God, with existence and the ten sefirot and four worlds being the manifested.

>>33737823
Imagine it like this. Once upon a time there were some fishes living in the water and also a tadpole who couldnt go out of the water yet. For the fishes, the only thing that "exists" is the water. Nothing else exists. They cannot imagine a world outside the water. They probably don't even know they are in the water, they don't know that water exists. They are in it all the time. They can't think of a way of moving that doesn't involve swimming. They can't think of a way of breathin that doesn't involve gills. Etc etc.

One day the tadpole turns into a frog and goes out of the water, onto land. The fish don't see him anymore so they think he has died (ceased existing.) Then the frog decides to go back and see his old fish friends in the water. He swims in. The fish are like "Omg we thought you had died! Where were you?" And the frog starts explaining to them that he was in the land. "What is land?" The frog explains that it is a place where there is no water, no swimming, no gills, you breathe through the air.

The fish don't believe the frog. To them, water, swimming, gills is all there is. So to describe a place outside of it is to describe something that isn't. They can't understand the frog and probably never will. The frog doesn't care, he goes in and out of the water at will. The only way the fish could experience the land is if they also metamorphized and grew lungs somehow.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33737858
In the same way as the frog and the fish, when you talk about a state without form,feeling,perception,sankhara,sense consciousness, then normal people will think it is non existence. Because they only know the existence through craving and self desire which creates karma/kamma ("actions") which creates new sense experience.

Actually there is another mode of reality whre you do not "grasp" after sense experience and try to mold and control it to be just the way you want it to be. but instead progressively let go more and more of your forcing things to be a certain way (craving). When you let go completely that is nibbana. It another way of seeing the world. Another mental posture.

These 2 modes of reality or mental posture are called samsara and nirvana.

I hope you can see now that nibbana has nothing to do with atheistic death or anesthesia or lack of experience. The mind goes nowhere. It is always there (citta). The only thing is that the citta learns to see the world in a different way. Instead of craving and getting, it just sees things as already perfect. It sees the inherent peacefulness in every experience. It comes from "nothing" and returns to "nothing". It is silent and peaceful and mysterious. And full of love and compassion.

If you want to experience first hand this second "letting go" way of reality, then practice jhana. In jhana you progressively let go of gross and subtle levels of activity (craving / formation). For example when you sit down to meditate you are quieting the gross bodily activity. Then when you enter 1st jhana you are quieting the five hindrances. When you enter 2nd jhana there are no more thoughts. Etc etc. Until nibbana.

You see that letting go is actually beneficial and positive and not scary. It is a process of acclimatization. Like leaving the water in little steps. When you are totally ready to let go then you can jump out of the water.

Hope this helps

>>33738819
My advice is mostly gender neutral but if you're feminine, a little makeup won't hurt if you know how to use it. Make sure it's made out of a formula that works with your skin. I like Urban Decay Stay Naked for foundation. Learn color correcting for when you have break outs. Green over red, concealer, and powder followed by your foundation then powder and setting spray. Don't wear too much makeup though or else you'll look bad. Neutral colors are best for lips, eyes, and cheeks. Skip contouring unless you are good at it. Skip false lashes unless you're in full glam. Workout at least 3x a week, don't skimp out on either lifting or cardio, both are important. Make sure you stretch too. If you want gains, try slow cardio such as biking or stair stepping. For general weight loss take on a treadmill or elliptical. Don't fad diet, make lifestyle changes that you will actually stick to. Learn to dress for your body type and shape and make sure your clothes actually fit. Build a staple wardrobe and have accent pieces. Too many clashing patterns and colors will draw too much attention. For skincare, sometimes the harsher stuff makes your skin worse (i.e. tretinoin destroyed my skin.) I use Olay gentle cleanser and their classic moisturizer. If you have acne some 2.5% benzoyl peroxide is going to be your best friend. Apply that before your moisturizer at night. I usually alternate between the BP and witch hazel at night. If you're sensitive to witch hazel, try a moisturizing toner. Some nights, maybe 2x a week, I will slug with some Vaseline. Don't use too much shit on your face or else your skincare routine will backfire. Practice self care too. Get massages, do yoga, get plenty of rest, drink water, etc.

posts.sub: A simple convincing explaination ehy the earth is flat
posts.com:
Disclaimer: I do not actually believe the earth is flat (or round for that matter) as I can't PROVE what shape the earth is. But what I can do is ask questions.

Ok, so here it is: Suppose some dude had a private jet with an infinite amount of fuel. Suppose he took of and quickly reached an altitude of 200 meters above the ground. Then he engaged autopilot and left the computer stabilize the plane at a vertical speed of exactly zero (meaning the plane should not be flying towards the ground or away from it). Then he left the autopilot on for like 10 hours and went to sleep. If the earth was a globe, when he woke up, he should see that the altitude of the plane was now orders of magnitude higher than 200 meters, even though the vertical speed had been zero all this time. (Why? Well, the plane was flying in a straight line, but since the earth is a globe the trajectory of any straight line starting at any given point on the globe, eventually has to leave the atmosphere and pierce out into space and beyond).

Obviously this does not sound like reality, intercontinental flights do not have to make constant vertical axis tilt adjusments just to keep a steady altitude.

Conclusion? You tell me. I think there is enough evidence already that either
a) the Earth is not a globe
Or
b) the Earth is MUCH bigger than we are taught.
Of course there could be other possible explanations which I personally am not smart enough to think up.
In any case, I am not here to preach anything, but this thought experiment is pretty funny in itself.

Say a fish was swimming at a 45 degree angle towards the surface. Why doesn't it continue going upwards once it exists the water?

A plane doesn't just go in a fixed 3D direction. It is constantly affected by gravity, and it "surfs" the air. And needs a certain amount of air pressure to do so. The more it is angled "away' from the Earth, the harder it is to fly in that direction.

What goes into affecting a plane's flight path is gravity, air pressure, the wing and tail flap position, and the engine power.
Gravity and air pressure naturally follow the earths curvature. The pilot only controls the flaps and the engine power. And keeping those constant, you'll just be like a fish trying to swim out of the water.

Tldr. gravity, and air pressure differences prevent any normal plane from traveling at a significant height, or at a signification angle form the earth.

>and no cogent refutation against the thousands of curvature debunking observations and photographs
FLERFERS LIE

Take a close look at the attached pic. Flerfers often post it as proof the Earth is flat. Why do I want you to look at it? Because it's a lie.

"The Australian Black Swan" tells you that the maximum line of sight for a 5.5ft tall observer is 2.35 miles. But the cliff is 7.8 miles away. So what's wrong with this flat Earth "proof"? *** Line of sight depends on both observer and target height, as well as on atmospheric refraction. *** The lighthouse is at least 100ft tall which means the visible cliff is at least 400ft tall. LoS for a 5.5ft observer of a 500ft (combined height) target is 35 miles.

What about the oil platforms? Ocean oil platforms have an "air gap" between the ocean and the first deck of 40-60 feet. Observer height was listed as 1ft (camera on the ground?). With a 40ft first deck the line of sight is 10 miles. With a 60ft first deck it's 12 miles. With a 5ft observer and a 60ft first deck it would be 14 miles.

At 6.21 and 9.41 miles you would still see the entire structure above the first deck even if the first deck was only 40ft off the ocean and the camera really was on the ground at 1ft. For the closer platform you would see some structure below the first deck. Note that we see more of the closer rig, proving curvature.

Here's a line of sight calculator: http://www.calculatoredge.com/electronics/lineofsight.htm

>but we're talkin' about muh horizon
>MUH HORIZON IS TOO FAR AWAY!
No it's not. It's between the observer and target in both photos. That's why the observer cannot see the very bottom of the target.

posts.name: Barggeist

>>33747672
Fair enough.


First, lets discuss the uses of colloidal silver, and where it works. The part of it that's not hogwash.

The article below suggests that there are some uses in terms of their antimicrobial properties, but it doesn't include in-vivo (testing on living organism) tests so keep that in mind.
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31963769/

Second, is of course why it's used as an application to the skin. As most are already aware, biofilms are a major barrier to wound healing, and experiments have been done on wounds to see if the rate of recovery accelerated. Due to the bacterial colonies being disrupted by the colloidal silver and several other phenomena, it will of course accelerate the healing process. Refer to figure 7.
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29589095/

Cont.

posts.name: Barggeist
posts.com:
>>33748051

Now, there's several problems with colloidal silver. The three topics are determining if it's colloidal silver, the marketing tactics that colloidal silver companies use, and lastly, why ingesting it in an uncontrolled environment is a bad idea.

The first problem is that a lot of them aren't even colloidal silver, so you must be careful on which products you choose. It's what I mean when I say it's "hogwash", a lot of them are just actual scams. Roughly 70% of them in total that this article surveyed showed that the products contained no colloidal silver but contained ionic silver instead.
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33376330/

Second, in terms of it being hogwash, is that companies in Finland have also been caught using "several scientifically unfounded claims" in the product. There are also many records on their marketing tactics and shows how they dupe their customers, mostly by using their websites and social media. Facebook especially.
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33437653/

Third, is to do with the toxicity of silver. This link refers to experiments done in terms of the toxicity, both in animals and humans, and simply speaking, the findings show that silver remains in the body for years. If the dosage isn't controlled correctly, it will easily damage the GI tract, neurotransmitters, the liver, the heart, the reproductive system, and the immune system. Thankfully it isn't very genotoxic. These experiments have tested ionic and colloidal silver.
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24231525/


So, in terms of the questionable marketing tactics, the fact that 70% of the manufacturers surveyed use ionic silver instead, and that ingesting colloidal or ionic silver negatively affect your health if not carefully administered, I would say yes, a lot of it is hogwash.

Again, it’s also largely anecdotal. There aren't enough studies done on the positive effects enough to recommend it, and ingesting it is a bad idea.

>>33748478
Oh, I see you have misunderstood the title.

The "Cosmic" in the title isn't meant to be taken in a spiritual or supernatural sense at all, it's completely literal.

The hypothesis we are trying to investigate is transpermia being a possible mechanism that spores could use to travel.

Based on the records we have, the evolution of fungi has been a problem, because the changes are not only drastic in their behavior in a short time, but it appears in multiple places in the world at the same time. It's happened multiple times before, some new species shows up, and sometimes it appears in multiple places in the world. The data also coincides well with meteor impacts, and it could answer the questions as to how strange illnesses, birthrate defects, and deaths without radiation ever being recorded in the samples for the meteors.

Most recently, you'll notice that as for a new pathogenic fungus, Candida Auris, had four confirmed different clades in the world, possibly five. Now how this species was able to be formed in four to five different places in the world is mind-boggling, even to pathologists. It makes more sense once you realize that within the same timeframe there were also meteor showers and impacts there as well.

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8346726/?report=classic

Before you ask, yes, fungal spores, and some types of fungi can survive in the vacuum of space and cosmic radiation.

Of course, we don't have any actual concrete data for that so right now it's pretty much just a hypothesis with good correlation. We'd have to get a sample and prove it's possible for fungi to travel in space.

Right now, we’re concerned on how to deal with this threat considering that a lot of antifungals that allopathic doctors carry on hand have stopped working, and that SARS-CoV-2 itself coinfects the patient with bacterial and fungal infections so it's virulence is now an issue.

I hope that clears things up.

While I don't claim to know this in any empirical way, it is my suspicion that the answer to Fermi's Paradox is simply "they're not there, because life is FAR less common than we think". A lot of the proposed answers to the Paradox are based on an old scientific altruism that it's best practice to go into an experiment from a philosophical position that neither mankind nor the Earth are special. This is a reaction to the enormous amount of special pleading retarded religions like Christianity tried to claim for itself in its failed attempts to explain ...well...ANYTHING about the universe. In general, it's a good mentality, with corrective properties. But it's just that it's only an altruism and not a scientific law. Sometimes a subject IS out of the ordinary, and if you don't take that into consideration, you will make mistakes.

posts.com:
i like Debussy. i think that music is a reflection of the universe/reality and can be used to channel certain energies. i think that people who listen to music, like actively listen to it and not just have it on in the background, are somewhat aware of that. and on that note, things like lyrics kind of act to distract you from recognized just what energies the music is trying to channel for you.
so, i feel similar about pop music, or any sort of corporate music, for that matter. when people sing popular songs, it's always the lyrics that they're reciting. never humming the melody, whistling some harmonies, not even going "tsst tsst" to the rhythm of the song.
but, in their head, the song is playing in full which means they're internally channeling that songs energies.
i don't think that the combination of lyric and music is always used nefariously, like the depression era music you posted. i think a lot of the blues greats were very much singing from their soul, and hearing those old recordings is like spending 3 minutes with that person and when it's over you feel like you've just shared a warm meal with them.
whereas listening to corporate music is like spending 3 minutes in a mcdonalds line, only to get your food and have it be cold while you slunk back to your car and eat it in isolation.

but yeah, i think i like Debussy the most. anything that feels like being outside really resonates with me. there's a band called Landing that feels like that to me, even though they have lyrics in their songs it feels like it's part of the music rather than a statement.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oCAvfgREBDA

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33748710
> it's always the lyrics that they're reciting
I could never decide if it was the lyrics or the music itself that chafed me. The lyrics are so trite, and with corporate music I always pick up on underlying themes that have a subversive nature. Then the music sounds like it fell out of a vending machine. The vocals so saccharine and shaved down. I know I shouldn't judge people who really enjoy that kind of thing, but it's hard when it makes me recoil so much and I cannot understand the appeal.

I have exceptions for some deeper cuts of more alt bands, ones that didn't have heavy promo money behind them. There's something wonderful about finding an overlooked song in a catalogue and thinking, man, maybe they really had to fight to get this one on the record since it's such a different vibe.

>like the depression era music
That was one of my examples of wholesome escape. The history behind them is wonderful. PBS has a great Ken Burns documentary on it. You can see how country becomes captured over time. But there are still incredible musicians in the hill country and Appalachia that tour here now and then. People who know pain, but it's given them a more unique understanding of joy.

Debussy is divine. A Chopin etude will never fail to elevate me. Same with Duke Ellington's Jeep's Blues

posts.sub: The overwhelming will of the parasite called destruction
posts.com:
As far as I can remember i have always been very sensitive and prone to anger.
As i have grown up, I have changed. I have built tolerance and understanding of others as well as my feelings. I have also built a mask, as everyone does.

However...
For the last few years, as I have mellowed out, a deep sense of depression has grown inside of me.
The anger I used to release by fighting with family and peers has been suppressed in my body and it is clawing at the walls of my heart.
I am unable to channel it in productive ways (art, sport) as I have lost all determination to do anything. Even when I succeed, like how I wrote a novel, I am unable to go onto the next step, such as publishing, as I feel so utterly lost. I work a full time mon-fri 8am-5pm job which does give me some sort of fulfillment, however its beginning to dim. I have a fiancee and we are looking to get married, but I have trouble expressing any love. Not that i dont love her, but my soul just doesnt seem capable of expressing it.
I left my family and friends to move to another country, so I dont have them to help me.
I feel utterly alone.

The overwhelming sense of anger and violence inside of me is the only emotion I can feel. It's not directed to anything, all it seems to want to achieve is to help me rise above others, controlling them.
But, I fail. I am pathetic.
I am a failed human being that is being consumed by a parasite called destruction.


How can I help myself? How can I leave this abyss? I feel something dragging me down further and further...
Has anyone gone through something like this?

Please, help me.

posts.com:
Coil
Manifesto
1983
The Price Of Existence Is Eternal Warfare

COIL is a hidden universal. A code. A key for which the WHOLE does not exist. Is NONEXISTENT, in silence and secrecy. A spell. A spiral. A serpents SHt round a female cycle. A whirlwind. A double helix. DNA. Electricity and elementals. Atonal noise, and brutal poetry.
COIL is amorphous. Luminous and constant change. Inbuilt obSOLescence. Inbuilt Disobedience. A vehicle for obsessions. Dreamcycles in perpetual motion. We are cutthroats. Infantile. Immaculately Conceived. Dis-eased. The Virus is Khaos. The cure is Delirium.

COIL are Archangels of KHAOS. The price we pay for existence is eternal Warfare. There is a hidden coil of strength, dormant beneath the sediment of convention. Dreams lead us under the surface, over the edge, to the Delerium state. UNCHAINED. Past impositions and false universals. Reassembling into OUR order.

COIL. Who has the nerve to dream, create and kill, while the whole moves every part stands still. Our rationale is the irrationAL. Hallucination is the truth our graves are dug with. COIL is compulsion. URGE and construction. Dead letters fall from our shedding skins. Kabbala and KHAOS. Thanatos and Thelema. Archangels and Antichrists. Open and Close. Truth and Deliberation. Traps and Disorientation.

Coil exist between Here and Here. We are Janus Headed. Plural. Out of time. Out of place. Out of Spite. An antidote for when people become poisons.

COIL know how to destroy Angels. How to paralyse. Imagine the world in a bottle. We take the bottle, smash it, and open your throat with it. I warn you we are Murderous. We massacre the logical revolts. We know everything! We know one thing only. Absolute existence, absolute motion, absolute direction, absolute Truth. NOW, HERE, US.

"Not Knowing What Is And Is Not
Knowing, I Knew Not"
Hassan i Sabbah

posts.com:
>be Pete Townsend
>be the frontman of The Who
>live through the hippie revolution
>all your peers get wasted on drugs and go to India because it's trendy
>they all come back with generic "brooo let's love each other" shit
>decide to instead become anti-drugs, anti-hedonism and follow a belief system based on finding the inner divinity of man after being wowed by Meher Baba's ideas
>you end up writing a weird album about a kid who gets raped and traumatized into sensory deprivation, who achieves higher spirituality only to lose it all when he reconnects with the material world
>against all odds it becomes so successful it codifies the rock opera genre
>try to make another album denouncing how no one understands yet and we live in a survivalist world full of spiritually lost teens and everchanging identical leaders who cannot help becoming corrupt
>it gets canned by label bullshit
>the surviving tracks are only remembered as memes (*freeze* *record scratch*, the Limp Bizkit cover of Behind Blue Eyes, the CSI YEAAAAAAH)
>unlike every other rockstar who went past the fad, you still follow your spiritual mindset to this day

Was he onto something or was he just the biggest mark of the psychedelic craze?

posts.com: I'm not sure why all these posters are so confused about OP's intentions. It's not so black and white OP, you are most likely to not become rich by advertantly giving away most of your income, but you (according to the general implications of virtue) should greatly increase in divine favor and grace. However there is no price tag on these things as God can and will dispense as He pleases. So I would still follow the advice to give what you can and don't hurt yourself trying to give more than you should, but there is also nobility to be had in giving it your all with only the best intentions in mind. I believe intention matters most here. Interesting question.

posts.name: Woodie
posts.com:
I practice folkloric sort of witchcraft and believe in Fayerie animism.

Firstly the term itself is fairly new early modern, derived from the Latin term Fatum (Fate), and came in use among celtic nations after Christianization. Hyper-localized ideas and expirences become the bedrock of the folklore, and as they are conceived of as diverse ecologies of invisible beings that live and indwell within an interior of landforms and weather forms. These can include the dead, star beings, house spirits, land wights, old gods and goddesses of the land. They can include beings of all sorts of roles, function, and dispositions. Lots of ghosts are considered Fayeries for example, like Thomas Reid, who supposedly was the familiar spirit of the Cunning woman Bessie dunlop.

I would say they are analogues of Jinn, Daimons, Genii (Genius) etc. In all the aforementioned analogues, hidden people with strange power, who can aid and harm, and are treated with fearful respect, sometimes being in anthropomorphic or therimorphic (and between) are common. Even some of the Goetics have some Fayerie like characteristics, and we often see Fayeries and Devils used interchangeably.

>>33724430
the term is used very haphazardly to refer to lots of different things, yeah. Its used as a synonym for "god" at various points, but is at others used to refer to dwarves, both in volundarkvitha where the very dwarf-like protagonist is stated to be an elf, and in voluspa in the list of dwarf names that includes the names "gandalf" (magical staff elf), "vindalf" (wind elf), and just alf (elf).
My pet theory is that, while the term elf is thrown around seemingly at random, there is a definitive group of things in norse mythology that could be called elves: the descendants of Lofar, a large family of dwarves who, it is said, "will be famous as long as the world exists."
This would mean that elves are essentially the germanic equivalent of angels- powerful beings that are servants to the gods.

>>33716143
My uncle saw one of the tiny folk one time.
He never drank or anything like that, was fixing a machine at the factory where he was an engineer and saw a tiny figure peeping out from behind something watching him fix the machine. He said "Come closer if you want to see what I'm doing!" to the little figure and the girl stepped out from behind some packing crates, then quietly watched him fixing the generator for a while then ran back behind the crates. He never saw her again.
I knew him well. He didn't make things up and was the most rational person I know. He said that at the time, it all seemed perfectly normal and it was only afterwards it hit him it was an odd event.
He saw her in the mid 1960s when he had a young family and only told his kids years later.
One thing I've come to realize is that life is never as simple and straightforward nor as mundane as one imagines. There are still mysteries around us.

>>33726022
Stonehenge is a bit touristy.
It's only the one with the biggest stones. There are LOADS of stone circles and other things.
There's a lake that never freezes (somewhere in Cumbria where my granny came from!) and some Welsh lake that people see lights dancing over which some think are 'earthlights' something to do with tectonic plates grinding deep under the Welsh mountains (the 'official explanation') or little flying 'visitors' people saw about town (the 'peoples explanation'); the "Lights of Egryn" is worth a read up about.
Everyone who comes to the UK seems to just go to the same places. Honestly every town here has something. You could spend a lifetime here and only scratch the surface.
Yorkshire has the moorland legends or Lancashire has the woodland legends (because we were never properly conquered by the Romans!) and Wales has the mountain and cave legends.
Stonehenge is nice but they shuffle you away after about five minutes.
You can sleep overnight on the stones of the circles in more out of the way places.
Sorry. Too long post. I love this subject. I'm fascinated by such things. I soak up stories like a sponge.

>>33726160
>Yorkshire
Tons of folklore in Yorkshire. Sacred glades, enchanted forests, bleak and spooky moorland. All the towns are stone houses and tough non-nonsense people... yet the best ghost-stories and some of the wildest legends around. The vikings owned and ran Yorkshire back in the day so tons of norse connections... even in the people's faces!
My granny used to tell my dad about the 'Croak-a-No-Cull'... which I figured out years ago is a reference to the 'Kraken-Knuckr' which is a Norse sea-monster. This makes sense because where she came from the town was once under Danelaw, meaning it was conquered and made an outpost by Viking raiders. That name must have been passed down and tweaked by the telling of the tale from granny to grandkids for a hundred generations.
>It's a bad night out! The 'Croak-a-no-Cal' will get ya...
Kept me by the fire as a kid, I can tell ya!

this
I once got chatting with an old bloke on a bus because some kids knocked his cap off and I picked it up for him and gave it him back. I ended up missing my stop. I noticed his hat had a red-ensign badge/pin on the inside... meaning he was a merchant navy guy.
He was torpedoed in the Mediterranean twice and manned an AA gun on a ship attacked by Italian dive-bombers when troops were going ashore in Sicily. I missed my stop. I never got his name. All because I asked him about the badge in his cap and said my dad was in the RAF. We are often surrounded by heroes and people who make 'celebs' look like nothing.
You don't ask. You don't find out. Their story goes untold. It gets lost in the shifting sands of history... like the lapping of waves erasing footprints on the beach.
Sorry.
Thread about the fae. I get sidetracked.
BTW fae in Cumbria can also mean 'people who have the gift' not just the 'little people'.
The 'gift' being second-sight or something similar... which is always called a 'gift' because the 'little people' were said to bestow it as a gift.
The two are intertwined somehow.

The little ones are more like animals. The large ones (elves) are the Tuatha de Danna (The Children of Dana), a nature goddess. They are all very alien to human understanding. It's really hard to stay perfectly still and quiet if they are nearby because they are really really bright and one popping off next to your face will always make you jump. House fairies are a whole different matter. My grandmother described them as having a little homeless drunkard stumbling around in your house from time to time. Breaking things and knocking over stuff all the time.

The only fae like creatures I know about that are local to my area, massachusetts, are the pukwudgies. They are short, 2 to 3 feet, and are mostly hostile to humans in these parts. Wampanoag (native american tribe) folklore says they were once kind to humans but turned on them when they got jealous over another deity.

They will play tricks or just straight up kill people, leading them off cliffs, using a spear or a bow and arrow. I frequent the hockomock swamp where they are supposed to be but so far I have seen nothing, though I do hear strange sounds after the sun goes down there compared to other woodland I go to.

A theory I have on them is that Erik the Red's son was killed by one of them. In the Saga it tells of them traveling down to "Hop" and then back North to "Kjalarnes Point". Some theories place "Hop" at modern day new york. Kjalarnes Point is described as a large peninsula with huge beaches (Cape Cod). They travelled into a river and spotted a "one legged man" who shot Erik's son with an arrow.

>>33738506
Lots of conflicting stories, but interestingly the type of story happens around the world.

Medieval Scottish claimed that the fairies were spirits that were in neither heaven or hell, but since they were not Christian they were technically under the dominion of the devil. And the devil demanded that they turn over their wisest and fairest to him each year. So they would kidnap children or beautiful people and ransom them to hell instead of sending one of their own.

>Wales it's believed that the fairies would kidnap beautiful children to raise, but replace them with their old and feeble elders to go die in the human world.
>Djinn also exchanged their elderly and dying for children, but so that the elder can be comforted and taken care of before they die.
>Huli jing in China and Aswang in the Philippines kidnap children to eat them, but leave a fake child in their place so the parents will not immediately notice.
>Irish claim fairy mothers cannot produce milk so they leave their children in place of a human to be nursed by a mother.
>Norwegians claim trolls replace their kids with human children to be educated and well fed by human parents. Trolls normally just eat the human kids.Other times troll societies would exchange children to prevent inbreeding, always against the wishes of the troll mother who would come looking for their kid

>>33749064
We are imperfect, and will always have a margin of ignorance in life. It's by our design.

I've been the same way in filling in gaps for myself, and it hasn't always been great. I've had two relationships where it felt like I immediately knew the person. A familiarity that was uncanny. I had trouble at first connecting them with their name, like it didn't fit them somehow. A strange deja vu of having been here before, of having had this same conversation before. Like the present moment was somehow a mirror of a distant memory. Both times I stayed too long because of this feeling, putting up with someone who didn't really value me the way they should yet wouldn't let me go.

I wonder if you have a strong Neptune in your birth chart? I know that's kinda goofy but this is /x/. Myself, people I know and famous people I've studied who have Neptune making a bunch of aspects with other planets in their chart tend to get wrapped up in spiritual feelings, prone to illusion and disillusion.

Knowing that you don't know is better than most people and actually a transcendent nature. It's a knowledge in itself, and knowledge tends to extract a price now and then. It's silly to let it eat you alive, because it's the nature of all people. Ask whatever it is that you believe in for wisdom and discernment. It will be freely given to you. Not that you won't have ups and downs, you'll just find more peace.

Those kinds of feelings are the exact kinds of feelings I was referring to. A sense of devaju as if I've met the person before, reliving a distant and fading memory. I'm turning 22 in April, so I have my whole life ahead of me to figure things out better. The only thing that struck me as odd about the person I met who I referred to in my original reply was that she had been the first and only person that I got those feelings with. It was strange, and as much as I had socialized in high school and afterwards, I hadn't ever gotten that feeling from anyone else. It was a feeling that made me not even care about being close to her in an intimate way, but I just wanted to be close to her. Now, reality is different than we can perceive it to be at times, and we aren't going to be right about everything, even if we feel like we are. For me, the feeling of being hoodwinked and blindfolded makes everything feel so much worse than it should in the first place. I suffer from something thats eating away at my psyche, and it's not something I've been able to get diagnosed for the 5+ years I've been experiencing it. As much as I've been able to handle this "condition" for lack of a better term, it is also getting worse. It isn't something physically wrong, as I've had a CT scan done without any physical abnormalities. there are reasons I don't want to discuss which prevent me from going to a doctor and asking for an MRI. I can't say for sure that I'll be as cohesive with my words or as coordinated with my thoughts by the end of 2023. The future is... Uncertain. I don't even know why I'm bringing this up. I'm just venting at this point, sorry.

I half made this post for a chance to vent. My whole life I've been lovebombed. It's gotten worse. But it's gotten easier through trial-and-error to walk the tight rope between buying it wholesale and cynicism... but it just won't stop happening. I would rather have silence or even insults over empty promises. This time I really did want it to be true, and ignored all other instincts in favor of this strange, ephemeral gravity. Feeling blue, and also feeling that it matters nothing to the other party and I invested under false pretenses.

I'm sorry for what you're going through. You are very young, and I can't imagine having gone through the last three years when I was at your age. I'm 28, and 19-22 was when I really started finding a path to evolve and strengthen. I'm glad things are physically wrong, I'm not sure what you may be missing with an MRI. Be careful with your thoughts, they have power. As within, so without. I think you might benefit from training yourself in that way, to not close yourself to opportunities by some self-prejudice that may be less than conscious of.

An early twentieth century cult established by a Jerusalem born Syrian Christian miracle worker named Salim Moussa Achi, known as "Dr. Dahesh". Dahesh means "astounder".

He converted many of the Lebanese elite to his cult. He would heal the dying, bring dead animals back to life, and even bring dead matter to life. The sister of the Lebanese prime minister observed him bring the painting of a bird to life. The bird flew off the canvas and lived as a pet.

He was eventually arrested and executed in Azerbaijan. He reappeared alive in multiple places at once. He lived for another forty years.

Daheshism can be summarized as belief in the existence and immortality of the spirit; reincarnation; the intrinsic correlation between all the major religions; spiritual causality and just reward (i.e. karma)

A great intro to the astounding miracles and occult powers of Dr Dahesh.
